concept.title: Information developer
concept.shortdesc: Information developers write DITA content, including task topics, concept topics, and reference topics.

conbody.p:
Information developers need to:
Select the appropriate topic type for the content.
Follow the user assistance guidelines for content.
Focus on writing and content, using DITA support for authoring the different information types.
Write content that makes sense on its own, so it can be accessed through search and still make sense.
Write titles and short descriptions that can be reused in links.

Because information developers use markup that describes the meaning of the source rather than its intended formatting, they can produce content that can be appropriately formatted for print or online, and filtered and reused in multiple contexts.
